About This Game

Uncover the mystery of the legendary Ghost Ship The Flying Dutchman in this challenging hidden objects game. Explore many locations and examine the evidence to find the truth behind the legend. Hundreds of different objects randomly hidden in dozens of locations will keep you searching for weeks.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows XP/Vista/7
    • Processor: Pentium 800Mhz Processor
    • Memory: 128 MB RAM
    • Graphics: 32Mb GFX card OpenGL support
    • DirectX: Version 9.0
    • Hard Drive: 100 MB available space
    • Sound Card: DirectX9/Sound Card

MirandaKym
464 products in account
38 reviews
Not Recommended
1.4 hrs on record
Posted: September 11
I don't like writing negative reviews but this game deserves it. I'm not even sure why I played it to the end.

Pros:

- The Title


Cons:

- The title is misleading. This game has nothing to do with the Flying Dutchman.
- Graphics are blurry and some items can't be seen at all. You WILL be using the hint button.
- Quite a few items are misspelled and some aren't even accurate. You WILL be using the hint button.
- The hint button takes forever to recharge.
- Music in no way reflects the pirate theme. But if you like Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairies...
- They ask for the same items over and over so after a bit, there's no challenge at all.
- Game is extremely short. Actually, this could be considered a pro.

Please don't spend your money on this game. It's one of the worst things I've played.

Emblem Parade
2,390 products in account
68 reviews
Not Recommended
1.0 hrs on record
Posted: May 14
There's something wrong here: some of the screenshots on the Steam store do not actually appear in the game. Considering how awful this game is, I am suspecting foul play.

What I got was a very, very bad pure hidden-object game (no mini-games, no point-and-click adventure).

It's very short (under 1 hour) and very repetitive. There are only a handful of scenes that you play multiple times. They are blurry and bad. Comically, even the text is blurry, such that it's hard to know what object you're supposed to find. And there are glaring spelling mistakes! Every time you click an object there is a 3 second wait before you can click the next one. During those 3 seconds you might get the urge to throw your computer out the window.

Also, please don't say "bird" when there are three birds on screen, thanks. That's, like, rule #1 of hidden-object games.

I had more fun writing this review than playing the game.
Read More

Puzzlefuzz
819 products in account
1 review
Not Recommended
0.2 hrs on record
Posted: June 14
I feel kind of stupid now... I read all the negative reviews, but ignored them.

This is probably the worst Hidden Object game I have played to date, and I have played quite a few. The graphics are so blurry, it is almost impossible to find what you are looking for. Even when I have used hints, it is impossible to see some of the objects, and that is when I actually gave up the game.

It seems the designers of this very lousy game did not even know the name of the items they put in the game. I was supposed to find a duck somewhere, and then when I finally turned to the hint-button, it marked the SWAN! Ok, "The ugly duckling", I know about that, but I highly doubt that was the intention here.

Avoid this game, it is not even worth the trouble of downloading it for free. Just stay away. Move along, nothing to see here!
